intro: Foullioya, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosettes of lanceolate, often hairy leaves. The flowers are small and clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences, typically with five petals. Foullioya species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
